name: Holy bath
description: Kumbh Mela is a major pilgrimage and festival in India. It is celebrated in a cycle of approx 12 years, to celebrate every revolution that Jupiter completes. It is celeberated  at four river-bank pilgrimage sites, namely - the Allahabad (Prayagraj) where the Ganges-Yamuna-Sarasvati rivers confluence; Haridwar - river Ganga; Nashik - river Godavari, and Ujjain - river Shipra. This photograph was taken during Kumbh Mela at Allahabad, which is now known as Prayagraj.
